scope.description: Aliases for well-defined Presentation Definitions IDs. It is used to identify which required Credentials and User attributes are requested by the Relying Party

client_id_scheme.description: String identifying the scheme of the value in the client_id. It MUST be set to the value entity_id

client_id.description: Unique Identifier of the Relying Party

response_mode.description: It MUST be set to direct_post.jwt

response_type.description: It MUST be set to vp_token

response_uri.description: The Response URI to which the Wallet Instance MUST send the Authorization Response using an HTTP request using the method POST

nonce.description: Fresh cryptographically random number with sufficient entropy, which length MUST be at least 32 digits

state.description: Unique identifier of the Authorization Request

iss.description: The entity that has issued the JWT. It will be populated with the Relying Party client id

iat.description: Unix Timestamp, representing the time at which the JWT was issued

exp.description: Unix Timestamp, representing the expiration time on or after which the JWT MUST NOT be valid anymore

request_uri_method.description: String determining the HTTP method to be used with the request_uri endpoint to provide the Wallet Instance metadata to the Relying Party
